content: I was using tsum, but was wondering if there are sums in lean defined so that if the sum diverges to infinity then the sum is equal to infinity

Yury G. Kudryashov , thanks. When I hover over the tsum with now terms of that type i still get the message that the sum will equal zero if it does not converge/(sum exists) ,but I guess that now diverging to infinity will be not considered as diverging?
That's right, in ENNReal you converge to +infinity :-) A more accurate explanation of tsum is "if it doesn't converge to anything in the target type then the sum will equal zero".
Pietro Lavino has marked this topic as resolved.
particularly, this fact that "all nonnegative sums converge on ENNReal" is expressed as docs#ENNReal.summable
